discourse_list.title: So. Is this really a part of eth?

content.content: Okinami token, okinamitoken on Twitter claims to be a token connected to the Ethereum Surge. It has characteristic traits like connection to Genesis & Russell Verbeeten on Etherscan. Theories are it could be a zk rollup. Is this real or yet another scam rug? Thank you. @vbuterin @timbeiko
content.GPT-summary: The post is asking a question about the legitimacy of a token claiming to be connected to Ethereum. The author is seeking feedback from Vitalik Buterin and Tim Beiko, and also advertising the token by mentioning its connection to Genesis and Russell Verbeeten on Etherscan.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Ethereum Research – 2 Jan 23    So. Is this really part of eth? Anyone can claim that they are building a rollup, they may also deliver or not deliver on their claims.  Their website doesn’t appear to make any claims and is just a link to their token with an unspecified purpose.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author is advertising proposal
